channel.title: History – Vamos a Bailar
channel.description: A traveling blog for discovering South America

item.title: San Agustin – The archaeological park and the coffee farm
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
The archaeological park In this park lived a civilization 2000 years ago. Scientists have not a lot of information about them except that they built a lot of huge statues. The statues were very impressive due to the size and the variety of forms. Although, that Guillaume and I enjoyed a lot the park and […]

The post San Agustin – The archaeological park and the coffee farm appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Cuenca & the Ingapirca ruin
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Cuenca A marvelous city I really loved this city. Rather quiet and the city center was beautiful. At each corner, I found nice buildings. My hostel was a bit away from the city center. However, a bit high, I could see the whole city where the churches dominated the whole. Feria in Cuenca During the […]

The post Cuenca & the Ingapirca ruin appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: My crush on Sucre
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
After being sick when I arrived, I continued to suffer due to the altitude. Sucre is located at 2,700 meters high. At the beginning, I got a headache and difficulties to eat. Only after three weeks of being at this altitude or higher, I could be normal again. Aside from this trouble, I was able […]

The post My crush on Sucre appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: How to enjoy your stay in Santiago
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Santiago is a huge city, almost half of the population of Chile lives there. Big, hot in summer and polluted, Santiago has a lot for frightening. However, I stayed a long time in Santiago. The main reason is that I have met a lot of friends during my last student exchange. But not only my […]

The post How to enjoy your stay in Santiago appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.
